title: Sample websites
text: Great examples of publications

title: Sample websites
text:
Add web fonts

Select fonts from here
Click Get font button at the right upper corner, click get embed code and select import.
Copy the import code to scss and add the name to Fonts as one of the fonts
Use the name for the mainfont option in _quarto.yaml

title: Taro Mieno
text:
Course Title


Description


Target Audience






Applied Econometrics (MS)


Covers simple univariate regression to panel data methods with particular emphasis on causal identification. 


Upper-level undergraduate and graduate (MS-level) students. 




Data Science for Social Scientists and Agricultural and Environmental Scientists


Aims at students with no or little programming experiences. Topics covered include, R basics, Rmarkdown, data wrangling, data visualization, loop, parallel computing, making tables. 


Upper-level undergraduate and graduate students.

title: Taro Mieno
text:
Online Resources





Title


Description






R as GIS for Economists


Provides guidance on how to use R for spatial data wrangling and map creation. 




Reproducible Research Projects and Journal Articles with R


Provides guidance on how to use R for reproducible research and writing journal articles using either Rmarkdown or Quarto.

title: Peer-reviewed Publications
text:

For a full list of publications including books, blog posts, etc, please visit my google scholar page here. Recent publications that I led all have the link to its project GitHub repository for reproducibility.

title: Taro Mieno
text: I am an Associate Professor in the Department of Agricultural Economics at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. My research focuses on the intersection of agricultural production and natural resource management, with a particular emphasis on water.

title: Taro Mieno
text:
Research Expertises
Precision Agriculture
Water Economics

title: Taro Mieno
text:
Education
University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign | Ph.D | 2009 - 2014
University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign | MS | 2007 - 2009
Hokkaido University | BS | 2001 - 2007

title: Taro Mieno
text:
Work Experience
University of Nebraska-Lincoln | Associate Professor | August 2020 - present
University of Nebraska-Lincoln | Assistant Professor | August 2015 - 2020

title: Third Blog Post
text:
The source for any page in your website could also be a Jupyter Notebook. This one is third-post/index.ipynb.
Here’s an example I borrowed from the Seaborn docs:

import seaborn as sns

sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Load the diamonds dataset
diamonds = sns.load_dataset("diamonds")

# Plot the distribution of clarity ratings, conditional on carat
sns.displot(
    data=diamonds,
    x="carat", hue="cut",
    kind="kde", height=4, aspect=1.5,
    multiple="fill", clip=(0, None),
    palette="ch:rot=-.25,hue=1,light=.75",   
)

title: Management of Groundwater for Agricultural Production
text:
Overview
The overarching goal of this project area is management of water (especially groundwater) for agricultural production. It covers wide area of topics including empirical analysis of the impact of drought on crop yield, theoretical investigation of optimal temporally flexible water quota designs, etc.


Key topics

Water policy designs (Quota, Permit Trading)
Economic implications of aquifer depletion
Water pricing
Agricultural policy (crop insurance) and water use



Related Research

title: Data Intensive Farm Management (DIFM)
text:
Overview
This project runs on-farm input (e.g., fertilizer, seed) experiments across U.S. (most in Midwest) and other countries (e.g., South Africa, Argentina), analyze the data, and generate input use recommendations to the owner of the experimental fields. This project also builds cyber-infrastructure to design and conduct on-farm randomized agricultural input trials, analyze the data, and create actionable input management reports.


Key topics

Economic evaluation of various trial designs
Evaluation of statistical methods to estimate site-specific yield response functions
Economic evaluation of on-farm trials

This package allows the user to design agronomic input experiments in a reproducible manner without using ArcGIS or QGIS.

This package lets you access Cropland Data Layer (CDL) data by USDA via the CropScape Web Service
